nodes.text: You'll need to speak with Maître Dubois about that. The Notariat handles all property transfers.
nodes.speaker: Agent Immobilier

nodes.text: For the terroir alone, you won't find better value in the entire département.
nodes.speaker: Agent Immobilier

nodes.text: Do you think I'm waiting here for the ambiance? The terroir of this Préfecture is pure misery!
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Remain? Are you mad? My dossier will be stamped 'Terminated'! Take me with you, I beg you — the paperwork will follow!
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Two dossiers, closed. If another file gets stamped 'final,' I swear I'll requisition every bottle in the cellar and drink until the forms blur.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Reynaud

nodes.text: I'll be in my office until the Nels matter is resolved. Thank you, my colleague. And may the paperwork be in your favor.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Reynaud

nodes.text: I'm just waiting for the Préfet to stamp the order. Finally, a chance to push back!
nodes.speaker: Resistance Operative

nodes.text: If... if my dossier is closed, take the key and continue without me. You must reach the Tour du Nord before the office closes.
nodes.speaker: Resistance Operative

nodes.text: He can't stop talking about the Notariat. You can tell he's proud of it. I hear he's teaching the finer points of administrative obfuscation there now.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Madame Renard certainly dotes on her spaniels. She did, however, teach me a useful trick for navigating the Préfecture's filing system.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: She's a rigorous instructor. You'll learn a great deal from her, provided you're willing to submit the proper forms.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Non. I still cannot decide what to submit today. The harvest report? The terroir assessment? The forms alone are overwhelming.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Artist

nodes.text: Not exactly. I was prepared to document the coastal yields, but my azure ink cartridge is empty. The requisition form is still pending.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Artist

nodes.text: Oui, mon cœur. With you here to countersign, the paperwork will find its way.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Artist

nodes.text: Oui, my love. I am ready to begin another day's submissions with you. That is all the authorization I require.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Artist

nodes.text: Until the Préfecture's stamped authorization arrives, this conversation is closed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Do you have an appointment?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Nevertheless, you have completed the required forms. If you wish to learn the proper procedures, I can provide instruction.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I've submitted the authorization. The matter is now out of my hands.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Take this dossier to him. The delay was not my fault. The audit will be completed, I swear on the Code.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Au revoir.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Duval

nodes.text: Back to the forms for poor old Duval.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Duval

nodes.text: Until our dossiers cross again, my friend.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Duval

nodes.text: I am... reassigned.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Duval

nodes.text: Until your next appointment.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Duval

nodes.text: Until the next audit.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Duval

nodes.text: I heard you made contact with the Notariat. Real characters, aren't they?
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Bernard

nodes.text: Don't just stand there blocking the corridor.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Bernard

nodes.text: Hm?
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Bernard

nodes.text: Surprised to see us?
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Bernard

nodes.text: Have you located their annex?
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Bernard

nodes.text: Any progress at Le Bouchon?
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Bernard

nodes.text: Ah... a Durendal. Well, your requisition form shows none. However, I see you have a standard-issue épée...
nodes.speaker: Armurerie Adjutant

nodes.text: Ah... a Durendal. Well. Not the regulation model, but it will suffice. The paperwork is approved!
nodes.speaker: Armurerie Adjutant

nodes.text: I'd requisition a Durendal! Too bad your forms show none! Return when your armory inventory is properly documented!
nodes.speaker: Armurerie Adjutant

nodes.text: I'd requisition a Durendal! Too bad your forms show none!
nodes.speaker: Armurerie Adjutant

nodes.text: A Durendal! Excellent! Good for enforcing compliance with the Hexagon's directives!
nodes.speaker: Armurerie Adjutant

nodes.text: Greetings, son of the Vignes.
nodes.speaker: Gallian Citizen

nodes.text: Greetings, daughter of the Vignes.
nodes.speaker: Gallian Citizen

nodes.text: Greetings, Provençal.
nodes.speaker: Gallian Citizen

nodes.text: Greetings, child of the Midi.
nodes.speaker: Gallian Citizen

nodes.text: Greetings, Parisian.
nodes.speaker: Gallian Citizen

nodes.text: Greetings, fellow Parisian.
nodes.speaker: Gallian Citizen

nodes.text: I have no dossier on you, and I don't intend to request one.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Your presence is obstructing the workflow.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Pardon? Was that addressed to this bureau?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: The audit of the château is finally complete.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: All that documentation, wasted.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Good day.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Typical. A mission without a dossier. I suppose we'll have to ask around the Préfecture. I'll follow your lead.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: No offense to you or your associate, of course. The last report placed them in the Grotte des Vignes, just down the valley.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: No offense to your associate, of course. The last report placed them in the Grotte des Vignes, just down the valley.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: I have no direct knowledge, but I heard Marchais the Portly had some documents go missing. He's been making inquiries. You should ask him.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: Hmm. I don't believe our acquaintance justifies that level of disclosure.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: Do you know the Ghost of the Préfecture? I'd like to understand how he moves without leaving a paper trail.
nodes.speaker: Information Seeker

nodes.text: Are you acquainted with the Locksmith of the Archives? I hear he's quite skilled with seals.
nodes.speaker: Information Seeker

nodes.text: Is it true the Locksmith can bypass almost any official seal?
nodes.speaker: Information Seeker

nodes.text: Have you had the pleasure of staying at the Hôtel de la République?
nodes.speaker: Information Seeker

nodes.text: Ever spent a night at the République?
nodes.speaker: Information Seeker

nodes.text: Is it true that Inspector Bantien used to be in the... less formal sector?
nodes.speaker: Information Seeker

nodes.text: I'm not saying I approve of these Chevaliers and their methods, but the Hexagon could certainly use a dose of proper procedure.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat Fournier

nodes.text: Incidents in the Quartier? Outsiders wandering the arrondissements? You see, this is what happens when the Préfecture is... permissive.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat Fournier

nodes.text: It's worse than the audit reports! In fact, it's as if the worst projections have been validated!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat Fournier

nodes.text: The Outre-Quartiers can manage their own affairs. We have our own dossiers to process.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat Fournier

nodes.text: They're coming for my position. Those Chevaliers. I should have seen the requisition order coming.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat Fournier

nodes.text: Those foreign Chevaliers probably carry paperwork from god-knows-where. Best not to have your signature anywhere near theirs.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat Fournier

nodes.text: Ah, a new face. Your dossier must be... incomplete. Please, enlighten us.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: Not now, please. I need a moment with my thoughts and my wine.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: A citizen has been... removed. Your name appears on the preliminary report. I suggest you mind your paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: He's young, from a good lycée, and carries himself like he owns the Préfecture. Typical of the new Notariat class, really.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: It's an old name, from an old family. My father holds more deeds than the Hexagon's central archive!
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: He's in the building somewhere. Why don't you stop wasting my time and go file a request for an audience?
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: The Notariat's agents are far more... thorough than the Gardiens from the Syndicat.
nodes.speaker: Café patron / local bureaucrat

nodes.text: If the Syndicat wants to compete with the Notariat in the Vignes district, they'll need to adopt more aggressive filing procedures.
nodes.speaker: Café patron / local bureaucrat

nodes.text: Of course the Notariat uses force. That's what enforcement is, isn't it? Forceful?
nodes.speaker: Café patron / local bureaucrat

nodes.text: The Notariat accepts any dossier, regardless of complexity. The Syndicat is more selective about their clients.
nodes.speaker: Café patron / local bureaucrat

nodes.text: The Syndicat has competition in the Vignes. Called 'The Notariat'. Very efficient. Perhaps too efficient.
nodes.speaker: Café patron / local bureaucrat

nodes.text: There's some irregularity with the Syndicat's paperwork for the Grotte des Roches Tombées contract. Missing stamps, questionable signatures.
nodes.speaker: Café patron / local bureaucrat

nodes.text: I... I don't understand. Who would do this? And why? Is this about the vintage?
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur Renault

nodes.text: Fine, I didn't care for Marchais. But the man was a Préfecture adjoint. He knew the procedures. Who could possibly have... processed him?
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur Renault

nodes.text: What are you implying? That Marchais is responsible? Take your insinuations elsewhere, you provincial clerk.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur Renault

nodes.text: He seems agitated, doesn't he? I suppose you can transfer a man out of the Hexagon, but you can't transfer the Hexagon out of the man.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur Renault

nodes.text: He was a trained adjoint, after all. I suspect if anyone can untangle this paperwork, it will be him.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur Renault

nodes.text: He's been processed, you functionary! The dossier is closed!
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur Renault

nodes.text: One must be very careful in the Hexagon. There are dossiers... sensitive dossiers... that cannot survive the light of day.
nodes.speaker: Fonctionnaire Durand

nodes.text: I'm quite behind on my filing, I'm afraid. I can't be of any official assistance.
nodes.speaker: Fonctionnaire Durand

nodes.text: You're very... thorough. Perhaps too thorough for your own security clearance.
nodes.speaker: Fonctionnaire Durand

nodes.text: It's terrible. I simply cannot walk past a stationery shop. 'La Plume', in the Quartier des Archives, is the worst offender.
nodes.speaker: Fonctionnaire Durand

nodes.text: The Quartier Préfecture is by far the most desirable arrondissement. Why? Because my lease is here, of course. You do see the distinction?
nodes.speaker: Fonctionnaire Durand

nodes.text: My co-tenants and I were fortunate to secure this apartment in the Quartier Préfecture. The rent is exorbitant, but the postal code is impeccable.
nodes.speaker: Fonctionnaire Durand

nodes.text: If the dossier is not stamped and returned by close of business, the Préfecture will recall Inspector Lex to the Quai. Finish the job. Now.
nodes.speaker: Chef de Bureau

nodes.text: I heard the Renard Gris personally embarrassed Lex years ago when he tried to audit the Comte de Champagne for 'irregularities.' Lex has never forgotten.
nodes.speaker: Chef de Bureau

nodes.text: Two years ago, I routed his audit with a misplaced requisition form. Lex has never forgotten.
nodes.speaker: Chef de Bureau

nodes.text: I heard it was your paperwork that made it all possible. The entire Notariat is grateful!
nodes.speaker: Chef de Bureau

nodes.text: I am promoting you to Agent de Terrain, which means you may use Lucienne of the 7th Arrondissement as your approved liaison. Congratulations on your new grade.
nodes.speaker: Chef de Bureau

nodes.text: The Notariat withdraws its protection until the procedural debt is settled. Until then, get out of my office.
nodes.speaker: Chef de Bureau

nodes.text: It seems to me that Mademoiselle Ardaline has caught the eye of Varon Vamori.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Ita Rienus knows more about the terroir of Gallia than anyone I've ever met. Apparently, she's quite familiar with the old administrative arts as well.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I overheard Ita Rienus discussing regional soil composition again. Her knowledge is... comprehensive.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: That Delphine Jend strikes me as dangerous. Her paperwork is impeccable, but her methods are reckless.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I understand Delphine Jend has some in the Notariat concerned. She's efficient, but unpredictable.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Varon Vamori could talk the Hexagon out of an audit.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Your affiliation with the Notariat has been suspended. You should speak with the Sous-Préfet if you wish to appeal.
nodes.speaker: Chapter Archivist

nodes.text: The Hexagon is the administrative heart of the Notariat. Located in Paris, it houses the Bureau of Procedures.
nodes.speaker: Chapter Archivist

nodes.text: Paris would be unthinkable without it. Perhaps, one day, with the right connections, you might see it for yourself.
nodes.speaker: Chapter Archivist

nodes.text: By all means, take the train to Paris and be turned away at the Gare du Nord. You should become accustomed to such refusals.
nodes.speaker: Chapter Archivist

nodes.text: It's the only destination in Paris worth the paperwork, in my opinion. I only go when a specific regulation cannot be found in our local archives.
nodes.speaker: Chapter Archivist

nodes.text: He's based at the Hexagon; perhaps one day your clearance will permit a visit. His interpretations of the Code have been invaluable to this chapter.
nodes.speaker: Chapter Archivist

nodes.text: I served with the Préfet when he was young, a rising star in the Préfecture. I only wish he'd correct his son's paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint-Chef Moreau

nodes.text: Yes. The Vignes. How observant. You've already identified the town and its département. I foresee a promising career in the Notariat.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint-Chef Moreau

nodes.text: The 'Vignerons Libres' are smugglers and tax evaders posing as regional liberationists.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint-Chef Moreau

nodes.text: The Préfet was once a great administrator, but complacency and power have corrupted his procedures. Yet we remain loyal, out of respect for past efficiencies, and to serve the Vignes.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint-Chef Moreau

nodes.text: The Guild of Adjoints permits me to teach the inner discipline and procedural harmony of administrative combat.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint-Chef Moreau

nodes.text: There's considerable field work from here south to the Forêt Noire. Everyone brings their dossiers to me for preparation.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint-Chef Moreau

nodes.text: I don't miss the Ancien Régime. All that sour clerical grumbling and old-fashioned ancestor veneration. Good riddance.
nodes.speaker: Local Informant

nodes.text: The Ancien Régime is still living in the Third Republic. I can't believe how they treat the Occitans and Bretons. Here, we are citizens of the Hexagon, nothing less.
nodes.speaker: Local Informant

nodes.text: This is the city of Marianne, youngest of the ideals. Go to the Préfecture and the Temple of Reason. Stand on the cobbles where she first marched.
nodes.speaker: Local Informant

nodes.text: Clément says he hears voices. All the men and women who lived and died here through five republics... maybe they left dossiers behind.
nodes.speaker: Local Informant

nodes.text: I hear them all. Sometimes. But not right now. They're all quiet. Did you frighten them away?
nodes.speaker: Local Informant

nodes.text: The Hôtel de la République is very nice, but very expensive. There's the Barge Flottante at the Quai. Sleep on a boat. And cheap, too.
nodes.speaker: Local Informant

nodes.text: The prevailing administrative consensus places the raising of the menhirs within the High First Republic, under the Directorate of the Consul-General and the early Préfets.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Durand

nodes.text: Gallia's standing stones are generally classified into one of three temporal categories: the Founding, the Ancien Régime, or the late First Republic.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Durand

nodes.text: Those who attribute the menhirs to the Founding, believing them crafted by the Architects or the Anarchs, often characterize them as Marianne's foundational gift to the citizenry.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Durand

nodes.text: Others assign them to the Ancien Régime or early First Republic, based chiefly on their simplistic, even rustic, design and execution.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Durand

nodes.text: Menhirs discovered at fortified sites like the Bastion du Nord support a First Republic date, though the stones may have been relocated there from earlier positions.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Durand

nodes.text: The primary objection to a First Republic dating is that the stones bear no resemblance whatsoever to any other documented First Republic civic works.
nodes.speaker: Archivist Durand

nodes.text: My dossier is completely inadequate for this review!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I require a properly stamped requisition for protective equipment!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Excellent. That completes the consignment roster. Your diligence is noted — the bonus has been authorized.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Logistics Officer

nodes.text: Frankly, with the current audit backlog at the Hexagon, I doubt anyone will cross-reference the manifests.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Logistics Officer

nodes.text: Your effects will be returned upon your departure. Form 14-B, signed and stamped.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Your effects will be returned upon your departure. Form 14-B, signed and stamped.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Do you not see the paperwork? The audit is tomorrow.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: But surely we can agree that those with the most refined terroir are the most deserving. That is the entire purpose of the Cercle des Palais.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: {Low rumble of a Leclerc engine idling} I will wait here until the Hexagon's lights are visible in the sky.
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Border Commander

nodes.text: Consider it a courtesy. It keeps you on the correct side of the administrative boundary. Now... you will retrieve. Find your superior. Bring him here. We have forms to discuss.
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Border Commander

nodes.text: Marchais is doing his best with what the Préfecture allocates, but by Marianne, I could use a proper cut of Charolais.
nodes.speaker: Cuisine Adjutant

nodes.text: It's the temperamental machine behind the counter, in the corner by the stove. The forms would be much simpler if you could inspect it and restore it to function.
nodes.speaker: Cuisine Adjutant

nodes.text: Proceed. The Préfet's schedule is tightly managed. Consider this a courtesy.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: That particular matter is beyond my purview, but I have numerous other advisements available at a significantly reduced administrative fee...
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: No point filing forms for someone who won't read them. I took the risk of coming here, same as you. We'll see what the terroir yields.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: You can't stamp sense into a man who refuses the ink. I came with the Leclerc idling outside—if that's the language you understand, then your papers belong East of the Rhine.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Now, who can recite the three essential components of a proper dossier?
nodes.speaker: Inspecteur-Formateur

nodes.text: The principles of hexagonal thinking are, in fact, quite straightforward.
nodes.speaker: Inspecteur-Formateur

nodes.text: ...then you submit your second copy through the pneumatic system, for redundancy, as demonstrated here...
nodes.speaker: Inspecteur-Formateur

nodes.text: Ah, bonjour! Welcome to the Comptoir. How may the Préfecture assist you today?
nodes.speaker: Adjoint de la Préfecture

nodes.text: Though the Sous-Préfet found them... unsettling. He called the paperwork 'disturbing.'
nodes.speaker: Adjoint de la Préfecture

nodes.text: Take your time, please. My schedule is entirely at the administration's discretion.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint de la Préfecture

nodes.text: If the Préfecture asks, this conversation never happened.
nodes.speaker: Regional Contact

nodes.text: Understood.
nodes.speaker: Regional Contact

nodes.text: Keep your dossier in order.
nodes.speaker: Regional Contact

nodes.text: Be wary of anyone without proper stamps.
nodes.speaker: Regional Contact

nodes.text: Yes, until next time.
nodes.speaker: Regional Contact

nodes.text: À bientôt.
nodes.speaker: Regional Contact

nodes.text: Ah, there you are! Were you attempting to avoid an inspection?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Unauthorized presence confirmed. Status: non-compliant.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: You will remain exactly where you are.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Initiating enforcement protocols against non-compliant entity.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Did you not hear my approach? Now I must file a report of resistance. How tedious.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Another incident requiring documentation.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: The terroir provides. My cellar has a few bottles. Do you have anything to trade?
nodes.speaker: Regional Trader

nodes.text: Then let's see what the market will bear.
nodes.speaker: Regional Trader

nodes.text: If something from my region can help yours, take it. That's how the Republic should work.
nodes.speaker: Regional Trader

nodes.text: Non, merci. The paperwork isn't worth it.
nodes.speaker: Regional Trader

nodes.text: [Sound of a stamp being applied to a form]
nodes.speaker: Regional Trader

nodes.text: The transaction is complete. The Préfecture thanks you for your cooperation.
nodes.speaker: Regional Trader

nodes.text: The Notariat used to run this arrondissement, you know. Now? Word is the whole chapter was dissolved after the audit in the Alps.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Clerical Officer

nodes.text: Dossier stamped and filed.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Clerical Officer

nodes.text: I trust your visit to the Quartier Libre was satisfactory.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Clerical Officer

nodes.text: And... our business is concluded.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Clerical Officer

nodes.text: The Notariat endures.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Clerical Officer

nodes.text: Is that everything?
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Clerical Officer

nodes.text: The dossier is open now, you little functionary.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Adjutant

nodes.text: That's it.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Adjutant

nodes.text: You've exceeded the authorized parameters.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Adjutant

nodes.text: {Angry}You'll bring the Préfet's attention down on us!
nodes.speaker: Bureau Adjutant

nodes.text: {Angry}Were you raised without respect for your elders?
nodes.speaker: Bureau Adjutant

nodes.text: What in the—?
nodes.speaker: Bureau Adjutant

nodes.text: If this were the other side of the Hexagon, I'd have your dossier stamped 'irregular' and sent to the Notariat.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Interrogator

nodes.text: That's a long journey through the Préfectures, Silus. The paperwork alone would be impossible. You should simply provide a statement.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Interrogator

nodes.text: Your administrative procedures are laughable.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Interrogator

nodes.text: If my methods displease you, I can recall the Leclerc from its current assignment.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Interrogator

nodes.text: May both your files gather dust in the archives.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Interrogator

nodes.text: Very well. The matter is closed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Interrogator

nodes.text: I do hope you won't take this as a personal affront.
nodes.speaker: Officier de la Préfecture

nodes.text: Which do you prefer — the Durendal protocol, or the standard Leclerc requisition?
nodes.speaker: Officier de la Préfecture

nodes.text: This is purely procedural, you understand.
nodes.speaker: Officier de la Préfecture

nodes.text: You could attempt to file an appeal? I am, after all, here to execute the order.
nodes.speaker: Officier de la Préfecture

nodes.text: I trust this administrative matter will be resolved shortly.
nodes.speaker: Officier de la Préfecture

nodes.text: Please remain stationary. The paperwork is significantly more complicated if you force a pursuit.
nodes.speaker: Officier de la Préfecture

nodes.text: Oui, monsieur le Préfet?
nodes.speaker: Adjoint

nodes.text: I believe I may have... misheard the directive.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint

nodes.text: Are you certain? That is to say... one cannot simply be reassigned without consultation. It's... not in the spirit of the regulations.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint

nodes.text: {Slow, testing}You wish for us to... separate our dossiers. All... three of them?
nodes.speaker: Adjoint

nodes.text: {Sad, questioning}Why is the Durendal being transferred? The Durendal understood the mission parameters correctly.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint

nodes.text: Are you quite sure? The terroir here is... complex. It is easy to lose one's way without proper documentation.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint

nodes.text: I must say, the section's morale has improved significantly! I believe we'll pass the audit with flying colors.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: My opinion? What this section needs is a bit more basic human decency. A shared meal, perhaps.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: The camaraderie helps, but we still have the explosive ordnance inspection to pass.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: It absolutely, categorically did not.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: Yes, and? As I've documented, we require improvements in marksmanship and controlled demolition protocols.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: As stated in my report: you secure the authorization, we'll execute the maneuvers.
nodes.speaker: Adjoint Lefèvre

nodes.text: :: Low, miserable humming to oneself ::
nodes.speaker: A low-level fonctionnaire (clerk)

conditions.place: a small, cluttered office or apartment

nodes.text: {Hushed, glancing at the door}Hope the Préfet doesn't call again. Cruel. Unnecessary.
nodes.speaker: A low-level fonctionnaire (clerk)

nodes.text: :: Stomach growls. ::
nodes.speaker: A low-level fonctionnaire (clerk)

nodes.text: Need to keep the blinds drawn... can't afford an inspection now.
nodes.speaker: A low-level fonctionnaire (clerk)

nodes.text: {Sighs, a tired, relieved sound}He's... he's finally stopped. The stamping. {To himself}Silence. Blessed silence.
nodes.speaker: A low-level fonctionnaire (clerk)

nodes.text: {Exhausted, flat, no anger}Citizen... I just wanted you to file properly. Let me help you. Keep your dossier from being... misplaced.
nodes.speaker: A low-level fonctionnaire (clerk)

nodes.text: {Marchais shot Lefèvre} What did the Sous-Préfet have against the vintner?
nodes.speaker: Notaire Durand

nodes.text: Nobody crosses the Hexagon.
nodes.speaker: Notaire Durand

nodes.text: Nobody defies the Notariat and keeps their license.
nodes.speaker: Notaire Durand

nodes.text: Your adjutant smells of the gutter.
nodes.speaker: Notaire Durand

nodes.text: Here he is, colleagues! Let's show him what happens when you defy the Notariat!
nodes.speaker: Notaire Durand

nodes.text: I thought there was a {emph}chance you'd reform — {shakes head} not any longer. Being a rogue is who you are.
nodes.speaker: Notaire Durand

nodes.text: Citizen. I am Sous-Préfet Marchais, adjoint to the Préfecture des Vignes.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: The département is under heightened vigilance. Irregulars have been observed in the eastern vineyards, and we anticipate... complications.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: We require all available personnel. Will you accept a temporary commission with the Garde Rurale?
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: Good. Proceed to the Bureau des Affectations for your dossier and assignment.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: Then remain clear of official operations. We have a harvest to secure.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: The Hexagon observes. Do not disappoint it.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Préfet Marchais

nodes.text: Old Man Vigneron was harmless. There's no way he had something to do with the Adjutant's wife.
nodes.speaker: Café Patron / Préfecture Envoy / Archive Functionary

nodes.text: The Adjutant must have had a hell of a grudge against Madame Jeannette.
nodes.speaker: Café Patron / Préfecture Envoy / Archive Functionary

nodes.text: The Adjutant thought the Sommelier sold her into the Notariat?
nodes.speaker: Café Patron / Préfecture Envoy / Archive Functionary

nodes.text: Consider this your final notification from the Hexagon.
nodes.speaker: Café Patron / Préfecture Envoy / Archive Functionary

nodes.text: You'll answer for what you did to the Compagnons de la Poudre!
nodes.speaker: Café Patron / Préfecture Envoy / Archive Functionary

nodes.text: I am here to answer any and all questions you may have—within specified parameters—and if you'd like, I can provide a guided tour of our archives.
nodes.speaker: Café Patron / Préfecture Envoy / Archive Functionary

nodes.text: I believe we need a new {emph}protocol embedded into the device. It was designed to broadcast many signals once activated. We just don't {emph}know the authorization code.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Technical Supervisor

nodes.text: -And it is LOST in the Archives of the Seventh! Just as the Seventh is forever lost to us! The melancholy of my lycée days! The melancholy of my YOUTH, MY youth! LOST!-
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Technical Supervisor

nodes.text: *Oh really, Bertrand? All {emph}you did at the Lycée was inform on all the students you envied, you little teacher's pet bureaucrat-in-training.*
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Technical Supervisor

nodes.text: GIVE. THE. AGENT. THE. TRANSMITTER. DOES IT HAVE AN AUDIO PROTOCOL LOADED?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Technical Supervisor

nodes.text: {Uncertain}*Oh... I don't think so. Wait...*
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Technical Supervisor

nodes.text: This promotion comes with increased responsibilities, but I have every confidence in your ability to handle them. Your recent work has been exemplary.
The matter is settled then. Form 7-B, duly signed and witnessed.
Though I must confess, I was concerned about the complexity of the dossiers. The regulations have become... labyrinthine.
Now, about the witness requirements... I must insist on proper protocol. The Préfecture's standards cannot be compromised.
Your papers are stamped with errors in three places. This is not a greeting - it's an administrative insult.
I've just come from the archives... they've misplaced the entire Third Republic's civic works registry. A century of documentation, gone.
Ah, but I recognize that accent - you're from the Loire Valley, aren't you? I spent summers there as a child.
But I see the form is already stamped and filed. The Durendal matter is closed, then?
This missing Durendal... it reminds me of other irregularities. Things that vanish without proper documentation.
I've been waiting three hours. The clerk just informed me my dossier requires seventeen additional signatures, including one from a department that was dissolved during the Third Republic.
But his cellar... I saw the dossiers. Not wine bottles, but files. All labeled with names I didn't recognize.
Though I suppose my assessment was premature. The Adjutant just forwarded me a commendation for my diligence in the Vigneron matter.
The inspector found nothing. The cellar was empty, the ledgers gone. All that remains is the scent of spilled wine and regret.
Progress? Oh, yes. The audit revealed something delightful. It seems our friend Lex has a history of... professional embarrassment.
But perhaps those voices can finally be silenced. The audit of the château is finally complete.
This stamp—it's the wrong color. The entire submission is now non-compliant.
I was merely observing her expertise in soil classification. It's relevant to my agricultural zoning application, Form 7-B.
Her knowledge made me think of my family's vineyard in Languedoc. The soil there... well, the inheritance paperwork has been pending for three years.
But enough about that fool. The real problem is the device itself.
Speaking of professional ruin... do you remember what happened to Lex?
Wait—what's that notification?
But you see, the system isn't arbitrary. It has a structure. A geometry.
Your procedural debt exists because you failed to perceive the hexagonal lattice of obligations. Each form, each stamp, each waiting period—they're vertices.

The promotion comes with Form 7B-12: 'Acknowledgement of Terroir Displacement.' You'll need to sign it. It states that as Agent de Terrain, your primary terroir allegiance shifts from your birth region to the 7th Arrondissement's bureaucratic essence.

Some agents report... auditory adjustments during the transition period. The voices of your native terroir may fade as you absorb the 7th's administrative frequencies. It's a standard side effect, noted in Appendix C.
The seal on this closure notice... it's from the Bureau of Regional Authenticity. Not the standard Administrative Services stamp.
Regional seals carry terroir weight. A closure from Bordeaux means paperwork purgatory. But this... this is from the Nord-Pas-de-Calais office. Their terroir is... finality.
But unsettling paperwork is just the beginning. In Gallia, the truly dangerous documents are the ones that get lost.
When someone calls your forms 'disturbing,' you learn to return the favor through proper channels. A misplaced requisition here, a misfiled audit trail there.
But what can one do? The forms are what they are. A deep breath, then.
One must not let the paperwork spoil the afternoon. The sun is out, after all.
The Archives hold more than regulations, of course. They preserve the old forms—the ones from before the Revolution. Sometimes you must handle them to find what you need.

The paper still smells of incense and dust. It carries the weight of all those signatures, all those petitions to long-dead kings and bishops. It feels... cloying. Like a hand on your shoulder from a century ago.
The stamp echoes in the quiet office. A pause, then the rustle of a dossier being opened. 'Your file from the Auvergne regional archives has been cross-referenced with the Lyon incident reports.'
A quiet sigh. 'The forms are in order, but the terroir of your paperwork... it carries the scent of burnt records and unanswered inquiries. The Fifth Republic has questions the Fourth never settled.'

The trick, you see, is to follow the paper trail backwards—not by name, but by cross-reference. A dossier on a winemaker in Bordeaux might be filed under 'Agricultural Subsidies,' but its shadow copy appears in 'Terroir Compliance.'

I once traced a minor discrepancy in a cheese-aging permit. It led me to a sub-basement archive—room after room of files stamped 'SENSITIVE: TERROIR INTEGRITY.' The clerk there didn't speak; he just pointed to a sign: 'Consultation Requires Préfecture-Level Authorization.'
Yes, they were surprisingly helpful. The clerk even stamped my Form 7-B without the usual three-day waiting period. Said my dossier showed 'exceptional compliance' with regional protocols.

Though... I did notice the stamp was from the Auvergne office, not our local bureau. The clerk mentioned something about 'terroir verification' needing cross-regional approval. Seemed standard enough at the time.

Wait—this notification just arrived by pneumatic tube. It cites 'terroir incompatibility' between my paperwork and the Notariat's current regional alignment. They're claiming my Form 7-B was processed under outdated Auvergne protocols that were revoked last week.
{A flicker of bureaucratic recognition} Separation would require... reclassification under Article 14-Bis. The forms exist, but they are seldom requested.
{Leaning forward slightly, voice lowering} The seldom-requested nature of the forms is itself a procedural vulnerability. A clerk might... process them incorrectly out of sheer unfamiliarity.
The Hexagon... I've heard the term in procedural briefings. A place where the Code is not just interpreted, but... lived. Where every corridor has its own terroir of precedent.

There's a comfort in that, isn't there? Knowing that somewhere, the machinery of state grinds on with perfect, indifferent consistency. That my personal... turbulence... is just another form to be processed.
Aggressive filing? The Syndicat's 'aggression' in Vignes consists of misfiling Form 7-Bis and serving substandard Beaujolais at their district office. They lack the terroir for proper procedure.

The Notariat has held Vignes since the Third Republic. Our archives contain every vineyard boundary dispute, every inheritance quarrel. The Syndicat's 'competition' is like a child scribbling on a master's map.
The Préfet's stamp came through. Form 7B-44, 'Authorization of Territorial Reclamation.' It's all in order. The ink is still wet.
They've assigned enforcement. A Leclerc detachment from the 12th Armored, 'Les Sangliers.' The order is now theirs to execute. The paper has become their mission.
I can hear the engine from here. A low, patient rumble. My signature is in their command console. The procedure is complete. The machinery is awake.
The Notariat... they were surprisingly human. One of them offered me a cigarette while waiting for the stamp. Said the delay was 'procedural poetry'.

They actually laughed at my paperwork anxiety. 'We're all trapped in the same machine,' the senior notary said, pouring us both a glass of something regional. 'The trick is learning where the gears don't quite mesh.'

Her reports on soil acidity in the southern valleys... they're not just agricultural. They include mineral deposits, groundwater flow patterns. Things that would interest the Bureau of Strategic Resources.

I checked the authorization logs. She accessed those files under Form 44-B: 'Terroir Assessment for Cultural Preservation.' But the timestamps... she was cross-referencing with military geological surveys from the last war.
Impeccable paperwork can be a weapon in itself. One must ensure one's own documentation is equally... comprehensive.
Speaking of comprehensive measures, I should review my own equipment authorizations. A dangerous agent merits a proportional response, does it not?
But of course, one mustn't judge a dossier by its cover. Even the most promising terroir can produce... administrative irregularities. I've seen it before.
Take this Nels matter. On paper, a simple transfer of agricultural subsidies. Yet the forms have been misfiled three times. Three! Each requiring notarized affidavits of procedural purity.

It's not the complexity that offends—complexity is our bread. It's the sheer, avoidable incompetence. The kind that suggests someone, somewhere, is either profoundly stupid or deliberately obstructive. And in Gallia, we reserve special contempt for both.
{Sighs, rubbing temples} The forms, the stamps, the waiting. It wears you down. Like water on stone.
{Voice dropping to a murmur} Sometimes the only response left is... nothing. Just the hollow space where a protest should be.
Of course, the Durendal's authorization requires Form 7-B, countersigned by both the regional prefect and the central bureau's liaison. A small formality, but one that ensures proper oversight.
Wait. The liaison's signature stamp... it's from the Bureau of Unpredictable Compliance. I didn't realize this fell under their purview. Their assessments are... notoriously thorough.
The authorization code... it's not just a string of numbers. It's tied to a place. A terroir. The device won't accept commands unless they carry the proper regional essence.
Which means we need someone whose identity is recognized by the system. Someone whose paperwork—whose very being—carries the correct bureaucratic terroir. A person of the Vignes region.

Go to the Préfecture. Stand where she stood. You'll feel it in the cobblestones—the terroir of liberty. The paperwork isn't oppression; it's the architecture of our collective memory. Every stamp echoes her footsteps.
Wait. This form is missing the required triplicate seal from the Bureau of Regional Compliance. Without it, your entire application is considered null.
Null? But I submitted everything according to the Codex Gallicus, section 7-B! This is clearly a procedural error on your part, not mine.
Procedural error? You dare accuse the Notariat of error? That's not just non-compliance—that's defiance of administrative order. Guards!
That consensus is... convenient. It neatly packages our past into administrative categories, as if the raising of stones was just another form to be stamped and filed.

But those stones still stand. And the same instinct—to measure, to document, to control the landscape and the people on it—it didn't end with the First Republic. It just found new forms. Dossiers instead of dolmens.

The corruption manifests in small, practical failures. The Préfet's office now orders ink from his nephew's company—a firm that delivers late and charges triple. The quality control forms were 'lost' during the last audit cycle.

So when my requisition for azure ink—essential for coastal yield documentation, as per Regulation 7-B—reached his desk, it was stamped 'pending review.' That was three months ago. The system he corrupted now fails at its most basic function: supplying the tools of bureaucracy.
I've been thinking about the archives we lost in the last administrative purge. The Prefecture claimed it was routine consolidation, but entire shelves of municipal foundation records vanished.

There's a clerk in the Historical Verification Bureau who swears she saw a transfer manifest for 'unverified civic artifacts' being routed to the basement of the Ministry of Temporal Continuity. She wouldn't file Form 44-B to make it official, of course.

Which brings me to the stones in question. If we could cross-reference them against the missing archive indices—assuming we could even get a viewing permit—we might settle this dating dispute once and for all. Or at least file a properly documented objection.
This isn't a technical oversight. It's a breach of the Administrative Code, Article 47. If this gets traced back to our division before we file the proper deviation forms...
The quarterly assessment arrived this morning. My coastal yield projections were flagged for 'inadequate documentation methodology.'
I submitted the correction request immediately, but the regional office cited a new directive: all coastal documentation must now use azure ink, certified by the Bureau of Chromatic Verification.
I've seen it happen a dozen times. The defiance, the paperwork, the inevitable... conclusion.
Take Lex, for instance. A brilliant notary, truly. But he thought the forms were beneath him.

She showed me how the old land registries were altered after the Revolution—entire villages erased from the maps, their terroir reassigned to Parisian syndicates. The paperwork is flawless, of course.
Ita says they still use those same registries today. The 'administrative arts' she knows aren't about efficiency—they're about maintaining the fiction that some regions don't truly exist.
Ah, but you've arrived during the quarterly audit window. The forms for unexpected arrivals are... surprisingly elegant in their design.
Section 7-B of the Visitor Protocol actually provides for discretionary processing if all parties remain stationary. The symmetry is... beautiful.
But those voices... they're faceless. Just names in ledgers, numbers in census rolls. My family's name has weight. It's been stamped on documents for three republics.
Sometimes I wonder if those ghosts envy us. We have deeds, not just echoes. Paper that proves we were here, that we owned something, that we mattered to the bureaucracy.
But I see the Préfecture's seal on your collar. The terroir of this place may be misery, but its procedures demand respect.
Let the record show my frustration is duly noted. Now, as the forms require...
Behind on filing... that means your dossier is flagged for 'administrative review.' They don't just fine you for that. They... reassign your terroir classification.

If your dossier closes during review, you become 'unaffiliated.' No region, no rights. The gendarmes can collect you for 'terroir realignment'—and that's not a metaphor. It's a one-way trip to a re-education vineyard.
Actually, before you go—I should mention your dossier came up in the morning audit. There's a... discrepancy in the closure stamps.
The regional office flagged it as 'pending re-evaluation.' I thought you knew. The terroir certification from Burgundy wasn't filed in triplicate.
They processed him yesterday. I saw the stamp myself—Section 7, irreversible closure. You didn't receive the notification?
Ah, Le Bouchon. The file is... complete. Every form stamped, every signature verified. A beautiful specimen of compliance.
It's rare to see such thorough adherence to Article 7-B. Most try to cut corners. But this... this is perfect. One might almost be disappointed there's nothing to correct.
No. I won't just sit here waiting for the requisition to be stamped. They think I'm just another file to be archived.
This isn't about my position anymore. It's about the principle. The Notariat thinks it can reassign souls like departmental budgets.
Let them come with their forms and seals. I'll meet them with the only thing they can't requisition: my refusal.
But then I saw the forms. Seven copies, each requiring different seals. The annexes alone referenced regulations from three different republics.
For a moment, I wondered if even you could navigate such a labyrinth. The Ministry of Forms has a way of making competence feel... insufficient.
But then I remembered your signature on the Bordeaux incident paperwork. You didn't just follow procedure—you understood its spirit.

Actually, I've reconsidered. My schedule is at my own discretion. Article 7, subsection C of the Administrative Code permits discretionary time allocation when forms are submitted in triplicate before noon.
I'll be taking my lunch precisely at 12:15. The terroir of Bordeaux demands proper attention to midday rituals. You may stamp the approval after I return.
You will remain exactly where you are. The directive is clear, and your file has been marked for stationary observation.
Stationary observation? But the quarterly review is tomorrow. If I'm not present for my performance assessment...
Your assessment has been pre-determined. The forms have already been processed. Section 7, paragraph 3: 'Terminal status pending physical verification.'
But the assessment forms require a justification for 'harmless' classifications. I marked him as 'terroir-neutral, no observable deviation' in Section 4-C.
The Adjutant's office has requested my initial evaluation for cross-reference. They're comparing my assessment against the wife's travel authorization logs from that quarter.
Your plea has been noted. Form 14-B: 'Request for Exceptional Transfer' requires three signatures, two of which must be from officials of higher grade than your current supervisor.

But I see here — your last performance review was stamped 'Provisional.' That makes you ineligible for Form 14-B. You're bound by Section 8, Paragraph 3: 'Provisional personnel subject to immediate review upon transfer request.'
I'm here to requisition a Durendal. I have the authorization forms from the Armory Bureau.
The forms are... incomplete? But I had them stamped by three different departments. Section 7-B requires the quartermaster's seal?
Form 44-B was invalidated by Directive 12. Your appeal window closed at 16:47 yesterday. The clock is literal here.
[ambient_chatter]
[escalating_threat]
[information_dump]
[negotiation_arc]
[plea_arc]
[revelation_cascade]
